  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      initialize the form and load in data from the selected part. Sets the correct radio button and label.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the path for the form
      resourceBundle - the data to be internationalized

    • onInHouse

      public void onInHouse(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onInHouse sets the bottom form label to "Machine ID" when the InHouse radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the InHouse radio button.

    • onOutSourced

      public void onOutSourced(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onOutsourced sets the bottom form label to "Company Name" when the OutSourced radio button is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the OutSourced radio button

    • onSave

      public void onSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onSave creates variables to hold new part data, and tries to assign them from their respective text fields. Several validation functions are run, and if each field is valid, a new part is created then added to the inventory. The original part is then deleted. If a field is invalid, a prompt displays detailing the error.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Save button.

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      onCancel prompts the user for confirmation, then switches to the Main form without saving part data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException - makes sure the i/o operation is not interrupted.

    • validateName

      public boolean validateName(String name)
      validateName returns true if the name is not an empty string.
      Parameters:
      name - the string to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if non-empty, false if empty.

    • validateRange

      public boolean validateRange(int min, int max, int stock)
      validateRange makes sure min is less than max and that stock is between min and max, inclusive. Returns boolean value based on results.
      Parameters:
      min - the min number to be compared.
      max - the max number to be compared.
      stock - the stock number to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if all checks valid, false otherwise.

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(int alert)
      showAlert uses a switch to display certain error messages to be used by other functions.
      Parameters:
      alert - the alert number to be selected and displayed.
